title: Bananington
author: Bananington
content: In some conversations that I have had with some rich people who are old, they most times always say that they invested in real estate and that was how they made some fortune. Young people understand that investing is key and paramount to securing a better future like these Old rich men did then, But the question now is what exactly to invest in for young people. Is it wise to follow in the steps of the old rich men who had investments in Real Estate, or do they completely now invest in cryptocurrency? The answer is sometimes traced to the one that offers the lowest risk and loss of capital. The less riskier from Real Estate and cryptocurrency is Real Estate, but less risk,, less reward. The risk that come with the higher volatility of cryptocurrency makes the profit that can be gotten bigger. Will you go for less risk, or big profit?

comments.body: We’re talking about real estate and crypto here which I believe we should have both because if you have your rental properties, that can give you passive income and in the future its value increases. comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: Quote from: Bananington on March 11, 2023, 08:26:31 PMWill you go for less risk, or big profit?Why not aim for both?  It is a win-win if we can find an investment that has less or manageable risk but can offer a big profit.  I think looking at Bitcoin's history, Bitcoin can offer both.  Investing in the right time lessens the risk and selling at the right time increases the profit.  We are expecting a 761% profit on Bitcoin when it breaks its ATH on 2025 if we invest today.  Regardless of whether hitting the target percentage or not, we all know that Bitcoin will surge after the Bitcoin halving so we might expect a 100% plus profit in a short period of 1 year.  And it is huge in terms of traditional investment.

comments.author: wajik-tempe
comments.body: If you're looking for a more stable, long-term investment with a lower risk of loss, real estate may be a good option to consider. Real estate can offer steady cash flow through rental income, as well as potential appreciation in property value over time. However, investing in real estate typically requires a significant upfront investment and can require ongoing maintenance and management. Cryptocurrency, on the other hand, can be more volatile and risky, but also offers the potential for higher returns.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: I can still remember the stories of my old relatives comparing the past and the present. They say that during their younger years, a man is not measured by his profession or job but his land. During their time, a farmer who hasn't reached high school but has a vast land will most probably be more attractive to a lady than a professional who has a university degree and has a stable job. Wealth is measured by land and not by monthly salary.My point is that things have changed now. An old man might find it puzzling how his grandchild prefers to heavily invest in something like Bitcoin rather than a farm, or a young child quitting school to pursue a possible career playing an online game, or a university graduate leaving his job to focus on his/her side hustle.

comments.author: Pokapoka124
comments.body: I agree with wajik-tempe, cash flow is very important in building wealth and investments in rental properties give a steady monthly cash flow which you can reinvest in another property. I love real estate, it’s a good way to build wealth if you know what you’re doing. There are ways you could buy rental properties without using any of your own money. Unfortunately, we don’t have such luxury with crypto investments.

comments.author: LogitechMouse
comments.body: This comes with different factors.What is your age? What is your risk tolerance? How much capital you have? Can you afford to lose money if worst thing happens?What's good with Real Estate is that, the price most of the time appreciates because land can't be build, and with many buildings being built on lands, the supply of land is decreasing while the demand is still increasing thus, making the price even higher. Cryptocurrency on the other hand, can give you huge profits especially in the bull run, but the risk is very high especially when you accidentally bought at the peak of the bull run. You might incur huge losses especially when you bought at the wrong time.Age is a huge factor with this one. If you are older, you can't afford to risk into cryptocurrency because of the losses that you can get. On the other hand, if you are younger, you can just take a huge risk and invest into some riskier assets like crypto because you can still work with the losses that you can get. TBH, the question is a bit subjective and it will depend on which person you are asking that with. As for me, I'd go for bigger profit since I'm young enough to take some risks, and as I become older, I will lessen the risks from my investments.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: The best is definitely to diversify your investments because you will not become rich from a single investment. In the past, investment options were limited, and therefore many people preferred real estate to the extent that here it is called “real estate is a good son.” But the investment obstacle 50 years ago and now is completely different.If you have surplus funds, start diversifying your investments as follows:Cash (for emergencies) 20%Bitcoin 20%gold 15%Shares15%real estate 15%High Risk Investments 10%Any other investments5%
